benchmark_details.name: CameraBench
benchmark_details.overview: CameraBench is a large-scale dataset and benchmark designed to assess and improve camera motion understanding, consisting of approximately 3,000 diverse internet videos annotated by experts through a rigorous multi-stage quality control process.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark and develop models for understanding camera motion in any video context.

data.source: Diverse internet videos collected from platforms like YouTube.
data.annotation: Annotated by experts using a structured quality assurance process.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons of model predictions to human annotations.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on comparison against baseline performance metrics of existing methods.
methodology.validation: Models were evaluated on their ability to classify motion types and perform video understanding tasks.
